column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=webanno.custom.RoleAnnotation|roles
#Text=Mr.
#Text=Faqiri (Afghanistan): I thank you, Madam\r
#Text=President, for convening today's debate, which offers\r
#Text=us all an opportunity to reaffirm our commitment to\r
#Text=protecting and ensuring women's rights and their\r
#Text=momentous role in peace and security.
#Text=I also take the\r
#Text=opportunity to thank the Secretary-General for his\r
#Text=report (S/2011/598*) and his strong words of support.
#Text=And I thank Ms.
#Text=Michelle Bachelet, Under-Secretary-\r
#Text=General for Gender Equality and the Empowerment of\r
#Text=Women, for her work and for her statement.
#Text=The history of war and violence has left a\r
#Text=disconcerting impact on my country.
#Text=Violence still\r
#Text=takes its toll on every Afghan's life.
#Text=I hope that the\r
#Text=anguish facing every Afghan family will one day come\r
#Text=to an end.
#Text=Women continue to bear the bulk of the\r
#Text=burden of conflict in Afghanistan, while their right to\r
#Text=secure, healthy and prosperous lives is still in peril.
#Text=We meet today to recognize the crucial role of\r
#Text=women in the peaceful resolution of conflicts, the\r
#Text=tangible fruits of which have already been seen in\r
#Text=Afghanistan in the decisive presence of women at the\r
#Text=Consultative Peace Jirga in 2010 and in the continuing\r
#Text=efforts to ensure women's participation in leadership\r
#Text=positions within and outside of the Afghan\r
#Text=Government.
#Text=The debate is particularly appropriate as\r
#Text=Afghanistan is entering the second phase of transition\r
#Text=to Afghan leadership and ownership and increased\r
#Text=responsibility for security and economic development.
#Text=With regard to development, we have begun to\r
#Text=implement our 10-year national action plan for the\r
#Text=women of Afghanistan based upon the priorities of the\r
#Text=Afghanistan National Development Strategy.
#Text=As part of\r
#Text=the action plan, we have established gender units in\r
#Text=14 of the 25 Government ministries.
#Text=However, given\r
#Text=the 10-year timeline, accelerated efforts are necessary\r
#Text=to ensure the full implementation of that very\r
#Text=comprehensive action plan, which incorporates vital\r
#Text=goals that include achieving a 30 per cent rate of\r
#Text=representation of women in governmental positions by\r
#Text=the end of 2013 and their 35 per cent participation rate\r
#Text=among university students by the end of 2012.
#Text=We have also made strides in ensuring the rule of\r
#Text=law, most recently the establishment of a national\r
#Text=commission on the elimination of violence against\r
#Text=women, following the enactment of the law in that\r
#Text=regard in December 2010.
#Text=Those steps have been vital\r
#Text=in enhancing Afghan women's access to legal redress\r
#Text=and have also sent a strong message that the\r
#Text=Afghanistan Government is committed to the rights of\r
#Text=women and to ensuring that there is no impunity for\r
#Text=those who violate them.
#Text=Ensuring the rights of women is only half of the\r
#Text=battle; we also need to see the full participation of\r
#Text=women, as resolution 1325 (2000) reminds us that they\r
#Text=have a vital role to play in peace and security.
#Text=The\r
#Text=representation of women in governance and their\r
#Text=political participation has steadily increased.
#Text=We have\r
#Text=succeeded in holding two presidential and two\r
#Text=parliamentary elections, in which women actively\r
#Text=participated as candidates, elections staff, poll monitors\r
#Text=and electorates.
#Text=Women comprise 25 per cent of the Parliament,\r
#Text=thus ranking Afghanistan thirtieth among the countries\r
#Text=of the world with the highest rate of women\r
#Text=representatives in Parliament.
#Text=The Afghanistan\r
#Text=National Parliament has also established a resource\r
#Text=centre for women parliamentarians to enhance their\r
#Text=capacity to effectively include women's voices and\r
#Text=perspectives in national development and\r
#Text=reconstruction plans.
#Text=When reviewing these facts and figures, let us not\r
#Text=lose sight of the great personal risk that these women\r
#Text=undertake in order to participate in the governance of\r
#Text=their country and in their future.
#Text=I wish to take this\r
#Text=opportunity to honour the women who continue take\r
#Text=risks in order to assume an active role in the future\r
#Text=direction, peace and security of our country.
#Text=Our international partners have assisted the\r
#Text=Afghan Government in our endeavours.
#Text=UN-Women\r
#Text=has administered a multi-donor trust fund for the\r
#Text=elimination of violence against women that provided\r
#Text=grants for national organizations to combat violence\r
#Text=against women.
#Text=I am very pleased to report that, in\r
#Text=collaboration with UN-Women, Afghanistan has\r
#Text=submitted its first country report on the Convention on\r
#Text=the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination against\r
#Text=Women.
#Text=The continued collaboration of our\r
#Text=Government, international partners and both Afghan\r
#Text=and international civil society groups will be vital to\r
#Text=ensure the full realization of women's rights in a strong\r
#Text=and stable Afghanistan.
#Text=Building a stable and secure environment that\r
#Text=enables women to live free of intimidation and\r
#Text=violence and promotes their participation and\r
#Text=leadership in efforts to maintain peace and security is\r
#Text=one of the core objectives of the Afghan Government.
#Text=We are also focusing on women political actors at\r
#Text=national, subnational and local levels, as well as on\r
#Text=capacity-building and advocacy strategies to enable\r
#Text=them to obtain critical roles in high-level decision-\r
#Text=making processes, policy and law-making positions in\r
#Text=key Government institutions and to assist them in\r
#Text=carrying out their significant political and social\r
#Text=responsibilities.
#Text=In conclusion, with the support of our partners\r
#Text=and the international community, we will continue to\r
#Text=work towards the full implementation of resolution\r
#Text=1325 (2000), while recognizing that our goal of\r
#Text=sustainable peace and security in Afghanistan will not\r
#Text=be achieved without the full participation of the entire\r
#Text=Afghan nation.
